test

Class MockServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • test.MockServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IServer

    public class MockServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements IServer
    This class implements the IServer interface, such that it may be used as a "dummy" server for testing purposes. The responses for the implemented methods are canned responses. For example, Login(...) will return true iff the inputed username is "test" and the inputed password is "pass".
    Author:
    Winston

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description

      Default constructor.

        public boolean login(UserCredentials credentials)
              throws ServerResponseException

        ServerResponseException

        public java.lang.String joinGame(JoinGameParams params)
                          throws ServerResponseException

        Specified by:
        joinGame in interface IServer
        Throws:
        ServerResponseException

        Post:

      • saveGame

        public java.lang.String saveGame(SaveParams params)
                          throws ServerResponseException
        Saves the current game state. Should return true if the save parameters are valid.
        Specified by:
        saveGame in interface IServer
        Throws:
        ServerResponseException
        Pre:
        The specified game ID is valid., The specified file name is valid (not null or empty).
        Post:
        If good input, returns a true and writes to a local file., If bad input, will return false and doesn't write to file.

      • loadGame

        public java.lang.String loadGame(LoadGameParams params)
                          throws ServerResponseException
        Loads a saved game. Should return true if the input string is valid.
        Specified by:
        loadGame in interface IServer
        Throws:
        ServerResponseException
        Pre:
        A previously saved game file with the specified name exists in the server's saves/directory.
        Post:
        If the operation succeeds, the game in the specified file has been loaded into the server and its state restored (including its ID)., If bad parameters, throw an error.

                           throws ServerResponseException

        Specified by:
        getCurrentGame in interface IServer
        Throws:
        ServerResponseException
        Pre:
        Player is logged in and part of the game, If specified, the version number is included as the version query parameter in the request URL, and its value is a valid integer.
        Post:
        If the operation fails, an exception is thrown

      • resetGame

        public ClientModel resetGame()
                      throws ServerResponseException
        Sets the game back to starting state, which is a canned response (a different ClientModel that that given by getCurrentGame method).
        Specified by:
        resetGame in interface IServer
        Throws:
        ServerResponseException
        Pre:
        Correct parameters are sent.
        Post:
        If the operation succeeds, the game's command history has been cleared out., If the operation succeeds, the game's players have NOT been cleared out., If the operation succeeds, the body contains the game's updated client model JSON.

      • addAI

        public AddAIResponse addAI(AddAIParams params)
                    throws ServerResponseException

        Specified by:
        addAI in interface IServer
        Throws:
        ServerResponseException
        Pre:
        There is space in the game for another player (i.e., the game is not full)., The specified "AIType" is valid (i.e., one of the values returned by the /game/listAI method).
        Post:
        If the operation succeeds, a new AI player of the specified type has been added to the current game.

      • acceptTrade

        public ClientModel acceptTrade(AcceptTradeParams param)
                        throws ServerResponseException
        Used to accept trades between player, should return a ClientModel that takes into account the newly accepted trade.
        Specified by:
        acceptTrade in interface IServer
        Throws:
        ServerResponseException
        Pre:
        Player is logged in and part of the game., You have been offered a domestic trade., To accept the offered trade, you have the required resources.
        Post:
        If you accepted, you and the player who offered swap the specified resources., If you declined no resources are exchanged., The trade offer is removed.

      • discardCards

        public ClientModel discardCards(DiscardCardsParams params)
                         throws ServerResponseException
        Discards a player's cards. Should return an correctly updated ClientModel.
        Specified by:
        discardCards in interface IServer
        Throws:
        ServerResponseException
        Pre:
        Player is logged in and part of the game., The status of the client model is 'Discarding'., You have over 7 cards., You have the cards you're choosing to discard.
        Post:
        You gave up the specified resources., If you're the last one to discard, the client model status changes to 'Robbing'.

      • rollNumber

        public ClientModel rollNumber(int number)
                       throws ServerResponseException
        Apply actions given a specific rollNumber of number. Should return an correctly updated ClientModel.
        Specified by:
        rollNumber in interface IServer
        Throws:
        ServerResponseException
        Pre:
        Player is logged in and part of the game, It is the player's turn, The client model's status is "Rolling"
        Post:
        The client model's status is now in "Discarding" or "Robbing" or "Playing"

      • buildRoad

        public ClientModel buildRoad(BuildRoadParams params)
                      throws ServerResponseException
        Builds a new road. Should return an correctly updated ClientModel.
        Specified by:
        buildRoad in interface IServer
        Throws:
        ServerResponseException
        Pre:
        Player is logged in and part of the game., It is the player's turn., The road location is open., The road location is connected to another road owned by the player., The road location is not on water., You have the required resources (1 wood, 1 brick & 1 road)., Setup round: Must be placed by settlement owned by the player with no adjacent road.

      • buildSettlement

        public ClientModel buildSettlement(BuildSettlementParams param)
                            throws ServerResponseException
        Builds a settlement. Should return an correctly updated ClientModel.
        Specified by:
        buildSettlement in interface IServer
        Throws:
        ServerResponseException
        Pre:
        Player is logged in and part of the game., It is the player's turn., The settlement location is open–  The settlement location is not on water., The settlement location is connected to one of your roads except during setup., You have the required resources (1 wood, 1 brick, 1 wheat, 1 sheep & 1 settlement)., The settlement cannot be placed adjacent to another settlement
        Post:
        You lost the resources required to build a settlement (1 wood, 1 brick, 1 wheat, 1 sheep & 1 settlement)., The settlement is on the map at the specified location.

      • buildCity

        public ClientModel buildCity(BuildCityParams params)
                      throws ServerResponseException

        Specified by:
        buildCity in interface IServer
        Throws:
        ServerResponseException
        Pre:
        Player is logged in and part of the game., It is the player's turn., The city location is where you currently have a settlement., You have the required resources (2 wheat, 3 ore & 1 city).
        Post:
        You lost the resources required to build a city (2 wheat, 3 ore & 1 city)., The city is on the map at the specified location., You got a settlement back.

      • maritimeTrade

        public ClientModel maritimeTrade(MaritimeTradeParams params)
                          throws ServerResponseException

        Specified by:
        maritimeTrade in interface IServer
        Throws:
        ServerResponseException
        Pre:
        Player is logged in and part of the game., It is the player's turn., You have the resources you are giving., For ratios less than 4, you have the correct port for the trade.
        Post:
        The trade has been executed (the offered resources are in the bank, and the requested resource has been received).

        robPlayer in interface IServer
        Throws:
        ServerResponseException

        Player is logged in and part of the game., It is the player's turn., The robber is not being kept in the same location., If a player is being robbed (i.e., victimIndex != ­1), the player being robbed has resource cards.
        Post:
        The robber is in the new location., The player being robbed (if any) gave you one of his resource cards (randomly selected).

      • finishTurn

        public ClientModel finishTurn(UserActionParams params)
                       throws ServerResponseException

        Specified by:
        finishTurn in interface IServer
        Throws:
        ServerResponseException
        Pre:
        Player is logged in and part of the game., It is the player's turn.
        Post:
        The cards in your new development card hand have been transferred to your old development card hand., It is the next player's turn.

      • buyDevCard

        public ClientModel buyDevCard(UserActionParams params)
                       throws ServerResponseException
        Player uses this to buy a development card. Should return an correctly updated ClientModel.
        Specified by:
        buyDevCard in interface IServer
        Throws:
        ServerResponseException
        Pre:
        Player is logged in and part of the game., It is the player's turn., You have the required resources (1 ore, 1 wheat, 1 sheep)., There are development cards left in the deck.
        Post:
        You have a new card., If it is a monument card, it has been added to your old development card hand., If it is a non­monument card, it has been added to your new development card hand (unplayable this turn).

      • playSoldierCard

        public ClientModel playSoldierCard(MoveSoldierParams params)
                            throws ServerResponseException
        Moves the robber to a new p;ace and possibly steals someone's resource card. Should return an correctly updated ClientModel.
        Specified by:
        playSoldierCard in interface IServer
        Throws:
        ServerResponseException
        Pre:
        The robber is not being kept in the same location., If a player is being robbed (i.e., victimIndex != ­1), the player being robbed has resource cards.
        Post:
        The robber is in the new location., The player being robbed (if any) gave you one of his resource cards (randomly selected)., If applicable, "largest army" has been awarded to the player who has played the most soldier cards., You are not allowed to play other development cards during this turn (except for monument cards, which may still be played).

      • playYearOfPlentyCard

        public ClientModel playYearOfPlentyCard(YearOfPlentyParams params)
                                 throws ServerResponseException

        Specified by:
        playYearOfPlentyCard in interface IServer
        Throws:
        ServerResponseException
        Pre:
        Player is logged in and part of the game., It is the player's turn., The two specified resources are in the bank.
        Post:
        You gained the two specified resources.

      • playRoadBuildingCard

        public ClientModel playRoadBuildingCard(BuildRoadCardParams params)
                                 throws ServerResponseException
        A player will place two roads on the map. Should return an correctly updated ClientModel.
        Specified by:
        playRoadBuildingCard in interface IServer
        Throws:
        ServerResponseException
        Pre:
        The first road location (spot1) is connected to one of your roads., The second road location (spot2) is connected to one of your roads or to the first road location (spot1)., Neither road location is on water., You have at least two unused roads.
        Post:
        You have two fewer unused roads., Two new roads appear on the map at the specified locations., If applicable, "longest road" has been awarded to the player with the longest road.

      • playMonopolyCard

        public ClientModel playMonopolyCard(PlayMonopolyParams params)
                             throws ServerResponseException

        Specified by:
        playMonopolyCard in interface IServer
        Throws:
        ServerResponseException
        Pre:
        Player is logged in and part of the game., It is the player's turn.
        Post:

      • playMonument

        public ClientModel playMonument(PlayMonumentParams params)
                         throws ServerResponseException
        Plays a monument card, which gives the player who played a victory point. Should return an correctly updated ClientModel.
        Specified by:
        playMonument in interface IServer
        Throws:
        ServerResponseException
        Pre:
        Player is logged in and part of the game., It is the player's turn., Player has enough monument cards to win the game (i.e., reach 10 victory points).
        Post:
        Player gains a victory point.

      • updateModel

        public ClientModel updateModel(int versionNumber)
                        throws ServerResponseException
        Polls the server for an updated version of the model. Should return an correctly updated ClientModel.
        Specified by:
        updateModel in interface IServer
        Throws:
        ServerResponseException
        Pre:
        None.
        Post:
        Gets an updated version of the model from the server. We will just change the turn tracker
